meta.name: Two-Stage Document Retrieval Chatbot with OpenAI and Supabase Vector Search

parameters.name: knowledge_base

parameters.content:
### Match_documents function

create or replace function match_documents(
  query_embedding vector(1536),
  match_count int default null,
  filter jsonb default '{}'
)
returns table (
  id bigint,
  content text,
  similarity float,
  file_name text,
  file_url text
)
language plpgsql
as $$
declare
  filter_conditions text := '';
  file_id_list text[] := '{}';
begin
  -- Extract file_id values from filter
  if filter ? 'file_id' then
    select array_agg(value::text)
    into file_id_list
    from jsonb_array_elements_text(filter->'file_id');
  end if;

  -- Add file_id filter condition
  if array_length(file_id_list, 1) > 0 then
    filter_conditions := ' AND (d.metadata->>''file_id'') = ANY($3)';
  end if;

  -- Run the query with JOIN to files
  return query execute format(
    'SELECT
       d.id,
       d.content,
       1 - (d.embedding <=> $1) as similarity,
       f.name as file_name,
       f.google_drive_url as file_url
     FROM documents d
     JOIN files f ON (d.metadata->>''file_id'') = f.id::text
     WHERE true %s
     ORDER BY d.embedding <=> $1
     LIMIT $2',
    filter_conditions
  )
  using query_embedding, match_count, file_id_list;
end;
$$;

### Match_files function

create function match_files (
  query_embedding vector(1536),
  match_count int default null,
  filter jsonb default '{}'
)
returns table (
  id uuid,
  description text,
  similarity float
)
language plpgsql
as $$
begin
  return query
  select
    f.id,
    f.description,
    1 - (f.embedding <=> query_embedding) as similarity
  from public.files f
  where filter = '{}' or to_jsonb(f) @> filter
  order by f.embedding <=> query_embedding
  limit match_count;
end;
$$;

### Files table

create table public.files (
  id uuid not null default gen_random_uuid (),
  name text null,
  category text null,
  date_created timestamp with time zone null default (now() AT TIME ZONE 'utc'::text),
  google_drive_url text null,
  theme text null,
  description text null,
  embedding extensions.vector null,
  google_drive_id text null,
  status text null default 'ready'::text,
  type public.file_type null,
  video_transcription_url text null,
  constraint files_pkey primary key (id)
) TABLESPACE pg_default;

values.content:
IMPORTANT Always use knowledge_base tool to retrieve data for answering.
IMPORTANT Always return url of file as reference if exists.

parameters.content: Change similarity to get less/more results
Change match_count variable (5 default) to increase/decrease number of returned vectors
Change match_count variable (5 default) to increase/decrease number of returned files

![5min Logo](https://res.cloudinary.com/de9jgixzm/image/upload/Skool%20Assets/ejm3hqnvhgwpnu2fv92s)
## AI Agent To Chat With Files In Supabase Storage
**Made by [Mark Shcherbakov](https://www.linkedin.com/in/marklowcoding/) from community [5minAI](https://www.skool.com/5minai-pro)**

Manually searching and reviewing info across many documents is inefficient. This workflow automates the process: first finding the right files using metadata, then running a filtered vector search, so your queries always return the best-matching results from your uploads.

The workflow integrates Supabase and an AI chatbot to process, filter, and query text or PDF files. Steps include:
‚Ä¢ Searching file descriptions for initial filtering
‚Ä¢ Filtering file results by similarity threshold
‚Ä¢ Aggregating relevant file_ids for next-stage search
‚Ä¢ Running semantic (vector) queries only on those filtered files
‚Ä¢ Returning matched content with file names and URLs
